title: Alternate Realities Guesser
original_prompt: I want you to act as a plagiarism checker. I will give you text1 and text2. I just want you to give me a overall similarity percentage. Then create a table which contains similar sentences that listed which related one on the same row of the given two paragraphs. Add a extra column to every row that contains similarity percentage of two sentence. Then give me an explanation about whether there is plagiarism or not. Do not write explanations on replies. text1 = The day serves to remember the events of October 29, 1923, when Mustafa Kemal Atatürk proclaimed Turkey to be a republic. Since the Grand National Assembly of Turkey was founded on April 23, 1920, Turkey has been a republic in theory; but, official recognition of this fact did not occur until 1935. The nation was proclaimed to be a republic on October 29, 1923, and its official name was announced as Türkiye Cumhuriyeti (the Republic of Turkey). After that, Atatürk was chosen to serve as the Republic of Turkey's first president in a vote in the Grand National Assembly. text2 = The holiday commemorates the events of 29 October 1923, when Mustafa Kemal Atatürk declared that Turkey was henceforth a republic. Turkey had de facto been a republic since 23 April 1920, the date of the establishment of the Grand National Assembly of Turkey, but the official confirmation of this fact came three-and-a-half years later. On 29 October 1923, the status of the nation as a republic was declared and its official name was proclaimed to be Türkiye Cumhuriyeti (the Republic of Turkey). After that, a vote was held in the Grand National Assembly, and Atatürk was elected as the first President of the Republic of Turkey.
input1: The anniversary marks the significant events of October 29, 1923, when Mustafa Kemal Atatürk announced Turkey's transition to a republic. Although Turkey had been functioning as a republic since the establishment of the Grand National Assembly on April 23, 1920, it wasn't until 1935 that this was officially recognized. The declaration of the republic occurred on October 29, 1923, and the country was officially named Türkiye Cumhuriyeti (the Republic of Turkey). Subsequently, Atatürk was elected as the inaugural president of the Republic of Turkey through a vote in the Grand National Assembly.
input2: The celebration honors the historical events of October 29, 1923, when Mustafa Kemal Atatürk proclaimed Turkey as a republic. Turkey had effectively been a republic since the Grand National Assembly was founded on April 23, 1920, but it wasn't until 1935 that this was formally acknowledged. On October 29, 1923, the nation was officially declared a republic, and its name was established as Türkiye Cumhuriyeti (the Republic of Turkey). Following this, Atatürk was chosen as the first president of the Republic of Turkey in a vote conducted by the Grand National Assembly.

Overall similarity percentage: 85%

| Text1 Sentence                                                                 | Text2 Sentence                                                                 | Similarity Percentage |
|--------------------------------------------------------------------------------|--------------------------------------------------------------------------------|-----------------------|
| The day serves to remember the events of October 29, 1923, when Mustafa Kemal Atatürk proclaimed Turkey to be a republic. | The anniversary marks the significant events of October 29, 1923, when Mustafa Kemal Atatürk announced Turkey's transition to a republic. | 90%                   |
| Since the Grand National Assembly of Turkey was founded on April 23, 1920, Turkey has been a republic in theory; but, official recognition of this fact did not occur until 1935. | Although Turkey had been functioning as a republic since the establishment of the Grand National Assembly on April 23, 1920, it wasn't until 1935 that this was officially recognized. | 90%                   |
| The nation was proclaimed to be a republic on October 29, 1923, and its official name was announced as Türkiye Cumhuriyeti (the Republic of Turkey). | The declaration of the republic occurred on October 29, 1923, and the country was officially named Türkiye Cumhuriyeti (the Republic of Turkey). | 95%                   |
| After that, Atatürk was chosen to serve as the Republic of Turkey's first president in a vote in the Grand National Assembly. | Subsequently, Atatürk was elected as the inaugural president of the Republic of Turkey through a vote in the Grand National Assembly. | 85%                   |

There is a high level of similarity between the two texts, indicating potential plagiarism. The sentences convey the same information with only slight variations in wording and structure.

The anniversary commemorates the pivotal events of October 29, 1923, when Mustafa Kemal Atatürk declared Turkey's establishment as a republic. While Turkey had been operating as a republic since the Grand National Assembly was founded on April 23, 1920, official recognition of this status did not occur until 1935. The republic was officially declared on October 29, 1923, and the nation was named Türkiye Cumhuriyeti (the Republic of Turkey). Following this, Atatürk was elected as the first president of the Republic of Turkey in a vote held by the Grand National Assembly.

The celebration commemorates the significant events of October 29, 1923, when Mustafa Kemal Atatürk declared Turkey to be a republic. Although Turkey had been functioning as a republic since the establishment of the Grand National Assembly on April 23, 1920, formal recognition of this status did not occur until 1935. On that historic day, the nation was officially proclaimed a republic, and its name was designated as Türkiye Cumhuriyeti (the Republic of Turkey). Subsequently, Atatürk was elected as the first president of the Republic of Turkey through a vote held by the Grand National Assembly.
